article.title: On the Origin of Sub-subgiant Stars. III. Formation Frequencies

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following theoretical SSG formation channels is represented by the purple line in the figure?
choices: MS Coll
SG Mag
SG MT
SG Strip

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the dark gray shaded area in the figure represent?
choices: The region of the CMD where red stragglers are found.
The region of the CMD where sub-subgiants are found.
The region of the CMD where blue stragglers are found.
The region of the CMD where white dwarfs are found.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which formation channel(s) shown in the figure can potentially lead to the formation of a blue straggler star (BSS)?
choices: SG MT only
MS Coll only
Both SG MT and MS Coll
None of the above

multiple_choice_question.text: According to the figure, which of the following statements is true about the observational properties of SSGs and RSs?
choices: SSGs and RSs have similar magnitudes but different colors.
SSGs and RSs have similar colors but different magnitudes.
SSGs are much more numerous than RSs.
RSs are much more numerous than SSGs.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the different colored regions in the figure represent?
choices: The probability of observing different types of binary stars.
The Poisson probabilities of observing SSGs resulting from different formation channels.
The evolution tracks of stars with different masses.
The distribution of stars in different star clusters.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to the figure, which formation channel has the highest probability of producing observable SSGs in both open and globular clusters, especially at lower cluster masses?
choices: SG MT
MS Coll
SG Mag
SG Coll

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the general trend observed for all formation channels in the figure as cluster mass increases?
choices: The probability of observing SSGs decreases.
The probability of observing SSGs remains constant.
The probability of observing SSGs increases.
The trend is not clear from the figure.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the vertical bars associated with the points from Monte Carlo simulations represent?
choices: The standard deviation of the mean probability.
The range of cluster masses used in the simulation.
The standard errors of the mean probability.
The uncertainties in the observational data.
